entry.et: Middle English chese, from Old English cēse, from Latin caseus cheese

def.dt: :a food consisting of the coagulated, compressed, and usually ripened curd of milk separated from the whey
:an often cylindrical cake of this food
:something resembling cheese in shape or consistency
:something cheap or shabby :cheesy material cinematic cheese

dt.un: used in the imperative as a warning of danger cheese it, the cops

entry.et: perhaps from Hindi cīz & Urdu chīz thing, from Persian chīz

def.dt: :a cheese similar to cheddar made chiefly in Cheshire, England
:a process cheese made from American cheddar
:a process cheese made by grinding cheddar and other cheeses usually with added condiments and seasoning
:an unripened cheese made from curd that has been cooked to a soft consistency called also cooked cheese

entry.et: Edward W. Coon, patenter in 1926 of a method for curing cheddar at a high temperature

def.dt: :a sharp cheddar cheese that has been cured at higher than usual temperature and humidity and that is usually coated with black wax
